            Bio
            Bruno Vidigal is a statistician at Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations in Rome, Italy. His work at FAO consists mainly of creating R plugins (internal API’s) to be worked inside the corporate Statistical Working System. He is passionate about statistics, data visualization, R and football/soccer analytics. In his free time he likes to go biking and running. He’s just started learning French.
            
            
            Education
            Universidade Federal de Viçosa | Viçosa, Brazil
            Master’s degree in Applied Statistics and Biometry | March 2011 - February 2013
            Universidade Federal de Juiz de Fora | Juiz de Fora, Brazil
            B.S. in Statistics | March 2007 - December 2010
            
            
            Experience
            Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations | Statistician | September 2015 - Present
            Neoway | Data Scientist | April 2015 - August 2015
            C&A Modas Brazil | Data Analyst | December 2013 - March 2015
            Hyperativa | Data Analyst | March 2013 - November 2013
